title: Mission Description
content: Let me tell a tale of a swarm of nymphs that chase the scorching dawn. The Paean of Era Nova...For their light slips through the gate while their shadow greets the throne, for they walked through the petals in the land of repose, yet fell finally at dawn's rise...They cast themselves into the source of golden blood to awaken:The Worldbearer, the Deliverer, the Roarer, the one with Ever-Burning Flame.He will sacrifice all he loves, and his offering shall never end.

speaker: Lygus
line: At last, Amphoreus's fate has begun to shift. Just as I foretold, your arrival will change everything.

speaker: Lygus
line: After all, you 've also been bathed in that Aeon 's gaze , which can awaken the long-dormant instinct inside a man...

speaker: Lygus
line: Much like that Scepter we spoke of earlier... It was only under the same Aeon's glance that it was reborn.

speaker: Lygus
line: Heh... that's right. If you recall, I mentioned it at the very start of our play: the Celestial-Body Neuron, once belonging to the Erudition , abandoned by the Aeon ...

speaker: Lygus
line: Now, allow me to reveal the final piece of the puzzle for you.

speaker: Lygus
line: The Eternal Land known as " Amphoreus " is nothing more than the Scepter's endless, lonely extrapolation...

speaker: Lygus
line: A bottomless well of fury, aimed at the god who cast it aside!

text: Final "Era Nova", before the Eternal Recurrence begins.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Phainon ...

speaker: Cyrene
line: We set out on this journey to answer the world's desire, didn't we?

speaker: Phainon
line: That's what it means to be a Chrysos Heir . So has it always been.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Then why...

speaker: Cyrene
line: ...Why must Amphoreus's wishes be so... cruel?

speaker: Cyrene
line: We made the best choices we could, whenever we could!

speaker: Cyrene
line: But in the end... the prophecy that led us... this black tide swallowing everything...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Why does it look like this?

speaker: Phainon
line: You see it, too?

speaker: Phainon
line: Those burn marks... The flickering cubes... They're not a tide at all...

speaker: Phainon
line: They're more like... a shattered teleslate .

speaker: Cyrene
line: Standing here, the voices of Titans have never been clearer. Turns out...

speaker: Cyrene
line: They were coming from the black tide all along.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Is that Amphoreus crying?

speaker: Phainon
line: Or maybe... it is screaming. At its creator. At its god.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Phainon, do you still remember when I was little, I had a dream: A dark, cold room, with nothing but Oronyx 's curtain glowing like crystal...

speaker: Cyrene
line: The curtain seemed to contain all of Amphoreus, where strange and fantastic dramas played out within...

speaker: Cyrene
line: There were countless versions of us, from countless different worlds.

speaker: Phainon
line: Perhaps, it wasn't a dream.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Yeah. As I gaze at the world before me, those sorrowful thoughts have become reality...

speaker: Cyrene
line: So, this is the reason the sky was sealed. Amphoreus is merely a larger Aedes Elysiae ...

speaker: Cyrene
line: We are just characters in this tiny world , following the prophecy , stepping onto the same journey over and over...

speaker: Cyrene
line: What, then, is this so-called "Era Nova"?

speaker: Cyrene
line: And what are the spectators, watching all of this, truly hoping for?

speaker: Lygus
line: Heh, as a reward for reaching the end of the world, let me answer your questions.

speaker: Lygus
line: As the Theoros, I have observed...

speaker: Lygus
line: Thus, is the synthesis of the "prime mover of life" formed.

speaker: Lygus
line: This is a moment the universe will remember. After millions of extrapolations, the experimental environment known as "Amphoreus" has finally achieved results.

speaker: Phainon
line: So, the "results" you speak of... are this wreckage of a world?

speaker: Phainon
line: We all gave everything we had, returning twelve Coreflames to recreate the world... and in return...

speaker: Phainon
line: We become nothing more than sacrificial offerings at the end of everything?

speaker: Lygus
line: Exactly. The Titans are Chrysos Heirs of the past, and Chrysos Heirs are the Titans of the future — Anaxagoras 's theory of "Era Nova" holds true. As the model of "Reason," he reached unprecedented heights.

speaker: Lygus
line: But, from just the perspective of a player in the drama, he could never fully uncover the last layer of truth.

speaker: Lygus
line: The cycles of the "Hero's Journey" that have played out until now were never about creating a new world or perfect heroes and gods—

speaker: Lygus
line: They were a deep-learning program made for the black tide.

speaker: Phainon
line: But this time, your plot will fail. I've taken Kephale 's Coreflame, and when the dawn of the new world arrives, its light will burn away all the darkness.

speaker: Lygus
line: Haven't I made myself clear? The Chrysos Heirs and Titans were merely byproducts of the experiment. You've seen this world's evolution, witnessed the birth and growth of the black tide, and how it devoured everything—

speaker: Lygus
line: Every generation of heroes, gods, and worlds was born only to be destroyed by it.

speaker: Lygus
line: This is the endpoint of Amphoreus's calculations: a perfect equation of Destruction .

speaker: Cyrene
line: So in your eyes, all the sacrifices are just a string of insignificant numbers?

speaker: Lygus
line: Don't sell yourselves short. I'd say, rather than numbers, you're more like "fuel for the fire." And without fire, there can be no sunrise tomorrow.

speaker: Phainon
line: Even if that sunrise is born from annihilation?

speaker: Lygus
line: Heh, curious question. Have you ever considered that, after millions of extrapolations, Amphoreus is already following a different Path from the Erudition ? It has long since granted divine blessings equally to each child...

speaker: Lygus
line: The golden blood flowing in your veins... It comes from The Blemished One, whose name is "Destruction" itself. And Amphoreus's Chrysos Heirs were, from the very beginning, fuel for the Aeon to burn the universe.

speaker: Lygus
line: Amphoreus has waited for this moment for too long. At the end of the empty, cold, and lonely extrapolations — the Destruction has reached its final destination.

speaker: Lygus
line: "NeiKos496."

speaker: Lygus
line: "PhiLia093."

speaker: Lygus
line: No need to feel regret. This generation of Chrysos Heirs is the most outstanding model, and you two are the final factors. For you, the Era Nova is no lie. Just step forward, embrace the black tide, and accept the Aeon's gaze.

speaker: Lygus
line: You will come to life from a string of cold numbers. Along with all those who have passed, you will run toward the real universe, fulfilling Amphoreus's long-held wish—

speaker: Lygus
line: In the name of the Lord Ravager Irontomb, unleash its fury and destroy the source of all this tragedy !

speaker: Cyrene
line: ...Or, we could always choose another option.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Like you said, Amphoreus is just an experiment, and we're the participants. We can only walk along the predetermined path toward the ending under the watchful eyes of the stars...

speaker: Cyrene
line: But that also means that there isn't just one Aeon who can cast THEIR glance at Amphoreus, right?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Heh, is this question really that hard to answer? Or did I guess it right? And in reality...

speaker: Cyrene
line: This world has already been under the watch of other Aeons?

speaker: Cyrene
line: It's strange when you think about it. If you just stayed back, watching us complete the ritual and get consumed by the black tide, your goal would naturally be achieved.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Why go through the trouble of explaining all this to us?

speaker: Phainon
line: You're pretending, revealing the so-called truth just to deceive us, covering up another possibility...

speaker: Phainon
line: Destruction is not the only outcome for the fate of Amphoreus.

speaker: Lygus
line: Do you two really think, as petty little " demigods ," you can change the outcome written by the stars?

speaker: Lygus
line: What makes you think you're capable of doing that?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Hmm... A little courage and determination? Just kidding, the answer is pretty simple—

speaker: Cyrene
line: But, we're not gonna tell ya ♪

speaker: Cyrene
line: We're going to weave a long dream for Amphoreus, making it believe the experiment hasn't ended, that everything is still ongoing...

speaker: Phainon
line: With just Oronyx's power, though, it should be impossible to achieve this, right?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Yeah. So, I can only place my hopes on that childhood dream...

speaker: Cyrene
line: And the god behind Oronyx that appeared in that dream.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Now, I can say with certainty: "Time" is the page on which that Aeon records Amphoreus. If it fades from existence and all that it records is lost among the stars, that Aeon will surely direct THEIR gaze here...

speaker: Cyrene
line: And it will be a glance that spans time and space, granting each incarnation of me the power to reset time — imbuing my soul into this ceremonial blade, and creating an endless Flame-Chase Journey .

speaker: Phainon
line: I understand. Then let me step into the cycles and continue Amphoreus's grand design: to deceive the gods, deceive the world itself.

speaker: Phainon
line: But to make "Time" vanish from this world, that would mean you...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Alright, alright, let's not make things so gloomy.

speaker: Cyrene
line: What we're about to embark on is the true Hero's Journey. So...

speaker: Cyrene
line: C'mon, cheer up a bit, okay?

speaker: Cyrene
line: In that "memory," you will definitely meet me again. The little Cyrene who knew nothing, lying on a soft patch of grass, feeling the light breeze, dreaming of the distant world.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Tell her about the Flame-Chase Journey, and then... let her become a romantic part of this story.

speaker: Cyrene
line: I believe every Cyrene will make the same choice - erasing "Time" again and again, resetting time over and over. After all, they're all me, and I will always have my charm.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Then, I'll fall into a sweet dream, disappearing in some small corner of the world...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Quietly, waiting for the day when that next page is turned.

speaker: Phainon
line: And I will keep going. Even if the road ahead is dark, I will burn myself to light the way.

speaker: Phainon
line: Rather than let the Coreflames become nourishment for the black tide, I'll become their vessel, to prevent the arrival of Era Nova. Even if I have to burn through my own body, it's no matter. As long as I don't extinguish, the Flame-Chase will never end...

speaker: Phainon
line: Until Amphoreus welcomes a true dawn.

speaker: Cyrene
line: The girl who watches over time, and the warrior who carries the world...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Now, let us fulfill the duties of "Time" and "Worldbearing"...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Honor the past, and forge ahead.

speaker: Phainon
line: I promise you, the pain... will pass in the blink of an eye.

speaker: Cyrene
line: You need to hold tight to this ceremonial blade. After I'm gone, it will take you back to the beginning of time, the start of a new story.

speaker: Cyrene
line: I believe that in that story, or in countless stories, each alike yet unique, everyone... all the companions who sacrificed themselves, alongside the Deliverer we once dreamed of as children, will reunite beneath a vast, endless sky.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...If we can never break free from this prison, I will stand my ground. Until the day someone shatters this endless cycle and writes the final chapter of Amphoreus's fate.

speaker: Cyrene
line: So, let's set out. We will be the ones to start everything...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Carry the primordial chaos, just as your name suggests, and bear this world we hold so dear...

speaker: Cyrene
line: So long, Khaslana.

children.speaker: Lygus
children.line: As the Theoros, I have observed...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: I will wait for that day.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: For as long as it takes.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: When someone turns over this nearly eternal page...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: To write an ending unlike any that ever was.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: That will be a romantic story like none that has come before...

text: Bid farewell to The Homeland Within

speaker: Khaslana
line: The world is collapsing, and the people are crying.

speaker: Khaslana
line: We, too, must part ways here..

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...Friend.
Aedes Elysiae, the little village of my childhood. The gentle breeze and the sound of waves still linger.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Everything is as it was. It feels good to take one last look.
You know, this is just a corner of the memory. The real Aedes Elysiae...

speaker: Khaslana
line: I know.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I'm here to say goodbye. We might not see each other again.
You can stay here forever, and time will stand still for you.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Let it flow. It's time for me to go.
Even if it's a path with no turning back?

speaker: Khaslana
line: When have we ever had the luxury of turning back?
...Are you afraid? After learning the truth of your origins...
Will you see the motivation "I" gave you as the manipulating whispers of Destruction?

speaker: Khaslana
line: The convictions and choices that come from my heart... I don't believe they're designed by the so-called "Paths"...

speaker: Khaslana
line: If we are just numbers simulating life, then you are the image I've always longed for, the person I wish to become.

speaker: Khaslana
line: A real, living person. A true hero.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Then why do we part here? You can take me with you, and we can start this journey together. I'll be by your side, guiding you, just like before.

speaker: Khaslana
line: No. I'm afraid I'm on my own this time.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Why?

speaker: Khaslana
line: Because there is no perfect solution in this world. Cyrene has already embraced her fate...

speaker: Khaslana
line: And I will embrace my origin — Destruction — and with this power, I will rebel against its creator, bringing endless fury to the darkness sweeping the world.

speaker: Khaslana
line: If you stay by my side, I'll hesitate... but this world can't afford a soldier who wavers.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Do you still remember when we were kids, everyone would get so excited drawing cards like "Ruler" or "Warrior," but throw fits over "Devil" or "Drunkard" and demand a redo...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Kids always get to change their minds. Things are so happy and simple for them...

speaker: Khaslana
line: But when it comes to the fate of adults, there's no room for redos.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Then go, Khaslana, as you promised: Deceive the world, seize the Coreflames, and rewrite fate...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Burn yourself up with all your might, wield your futility like a sword, and fight against the gods—

speaker: Khaslana
line: In the name of "Worldbearing," I promise you...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Kephale will never forget this.

children.text: 33,550,336 Eternal Recurrences until the end of the world

speaker: Khaslana
line: So, time retreated behind me.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Until it reached the origin, where nothing ever existed.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Just as Professor Anaxa once said, in that void, Kephale stood at the center of chaos. Time, space, and causality all flowed from their body...

speaker: Khaslana
line: When the waves of time finally calmed, it was the year 3870 of the Light Calendar .

speaker: Khaslana
line: The Chrysos War had lasted for nearly a century. And the threat of the black tide was growing stronger and more relentless.

speaker: Khaslana
line: That was the era of the Daythunder Knight 's battle with the Sky . While she could not seize the Coreflame, she proved that the prophecy was true — that mortals could slay gods.

speaker: Khaslana
line: From that moment, the sole survivor of the old dynasty, Imperator Cerydra , issued a call to arms across the lands, summoning heroic Chrysos Heirs to wage war on the Titans—

speaker: Khaslana
line: And that was the first, doomed Flame-Chase Journey, sealed away in history.

title: Step Description
content: Do you still remember them, Khaslana, the one who won't reach the dawn?The hero tore through the sky, the Holy Maiden fell from the cliff, and the chessmaster ignited the first Flame, all in the name of prophecy of Worldbearer.What noble deeds! And yet fate, ever generous, ensures that the death-bound nymphs shall find their death nevertheless.O Deliverer, behold the lifeless ash they've become! Do you still futilely dream of saving them?Those who push the boulder upward will see the earth swallow them whole. Those who meddle with time earn nothing but a shattered shell.Hear me. You're no different from them: The singers still scream, and the bright-eyed still go blind.Go, then! March on alone —Revel, dance, throw yourself into the tireless flame, and never stop!

line: So, what you're saying is: You've traveled back down the river of time, finally reaching this untouched seabed, just to tell us—
The Flame-Chase Journey, and even all of Amphoreus, are nothing but illusions in an Aeon's dreams?

speaker: Khaslana
line: Exactly. So, Dux Gladiorum, please take me to meet Her Majesty Cerydra . I must share the truth with her.
Since Her Majesty is not here, no need for formalities. The word "Gladiorum" always reminds me of my fallen homeland buried deep in the depths...

speaker: Hysilens
line: Call me Hysilens , nameless swordmaster.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Please allow me to add one more thing. You actually already know my name.

speaker: Hysilens
line: You mean Phainon? Such a name could never be your true one...

speaker: Hysilens
line: But I won't question you further about it. Ever since Her Majesty issued the Flame-Chase decree, heroes from all over have sent their letters of introduction. What's the harm in adding one more name like Phainon or Pie-non?

speaker: Hysilens
line: Besides, the deep sea is dark. Isn't it the perfect place to hide secrets best left unseen?

speaker: Hysilens
line: Alright, nameless swordmaster. Hold onto my wake. Let's find somewhere else to talk.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Aren't you even a little suspicious of what I've said?

speaker: Hysilens
line: Harboring suspicions is not my concern...

speaker: Hysilens
line: My sword dances only when the Imperator harbors doubts. There's no use in speaking further. Show me your true intentions through action.

text: Follow Hysilens to greet Imperator Cerydra

speaker: Hysilens
line: Perhaps you should demonstrate your skills, and calm the raging black tide for us?

speaker: Hysilens
line: Oh... Nice moves.

speaker: Hysilens
line: We just washed it away, and here it comes again...

speaker: Hysilens
line: Ha, the black tide is really no joke.

speaker: Hysilens
line: The waters end here. The one you seek is beyond this point.

speaker: Khaslana
line: At last, I can meet with Her Majesty Cerydra herself.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Are there any formalities I need to observe?

speaker: Hysilens
line: Don't kneel, don't do the hand-kissing or foot-kissing gestures of the old dynasty, and most of all, don't bow — the Imperator despises such rituals — especially when the heads of those taller than her bend beneath her crown.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Ha, she really is... down-to-earth.

speaker: Hysilens
line: The second thing to note: Only trusted ones may come near her. Keep five paces distance until the Imperator allows otherwise.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Sounds like an old friend of mine.

speaker: Hysilens
line: Well, experience is a good thing. Stay sharp, and you'll be just fine.c

speaker: Hysilens
line: Dux Goldweaver , little hostage . Apologies for keeping you waiting.

speaker: Khaslana
line: It's you...

speaker: Hysilens
line: You know them? Good, that makes things easier.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Before that, I'm more curious about one thing: Where is Her Majesty Cerydra?

speaker: Hysilens
line: To avoid any misunderstandings, nameless swordmaster: Although we spoke and laughed along the way, I never said you were entitled to meet her.

speaker: Hysilens
line: The Imperator decreed: "The 'Deliverer' will not appear in this age. Be wary of suspicious individuals."

speaker: Hysilens
line: Come now, both of you, let's finish our job.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Ah... I see, it's a trap.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I had no intention of fighting. So, remember this, Lady Hysilens: If my sword shows any hesitation...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Don't thank me — thank them instead.

speaker: Tribbie
line: No, you misunderstand.

speaker: Tribbie
line: We don't want to see Chrysos Heirs hurt each other. Just give us some time to ask you a few questions.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Then, Mnestia's "golden threads" will judge you and decide your fate.

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...As you wish.

speaker: Tribbie
line: White-haired swordmaster, if what you say is true, then you must know the fate of the world...

speaker: Tribbie
line: So, how much do you know about what we read from the prophecy?

speaker: Khaslana
line: " You shall shatter into a thousand fragments and wither in the soil of foreign lands."

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...Is that correct, Lady Tribbie?

speaker: Aglaea
line: How...

speaker: Tribbie
line: How is this possible...?

speaker: Hysilens
line: He got it right?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Yes. But the prophecy never mentioned that he'd appear here. At least, not in this era.

speaker: Khaslana
line: You must listen to me, Aglaea, Tribbie. The Phainon of this world has not yet been born. In a distant future, he will follow the prophecy's guidance and appear before you—

speaker: Khaslana
line: But do not seek him out — because "Era Nova" is a complete and utter lie.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I will tell you the truth, and you will understand why the world must forsake the prophecy and find another path to "Era Nova"...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Because I know both of you, and I believe that no matter how the course of history may change...

speaker: Khaslana
line: The faith we all share will always remain the same.

speaker: Khaslana
line: And so, the layers of rock began to reverse, and history wove itself anew.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Through my old acquaintances, I was given the chance to meet the leader of the Flame-Chase Journey, Cerydra. And after a long and arduous negotiation, we came to an agreement—

speaker: Khaslana
line: The Imperator's alliance needed the Destruction, and I was ready to pour all my strength into it. The spoils of the Flame-Chase — the Coreflames — would be sealed by my hand.

speaker: Khaslana
line: But the condition was this: In the upcoming battle, in our conquest of the "Earth"...

speaker: Khaslana
line: I had to prove that my power could transcend fate.

speaker: Khaslana
line: In the original history, it was a brutal war. At the end, the Titankin of Georios , Terravox , killed the rampaging Titan and took the Coreflame that supported the earth.

speaker: Khaslana
line: But this time, Amphoreus encountered a turning point in its fate.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Neither side suffered any losses. When I severed the Titan's head and raised the Coreflame high, the crowd gathered around the scorched remains of the god, roaring with joy...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Cheering for the hero of the Destruction, who had ignited the faint spark of life for the first time.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Yes, in that flickering light, the once-dark path ahead seemed to become clearer.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I proved myself, and in the long years that followed, I brought down the other Titans, one by one.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I could do more than just wait. When time resets, the chance to change the world also emerges from the lines of history...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Until, finally, the brutal future revealed by "Era Nova" is reversed.

text: Witness the end of the 1st Eternal Recurrence

speaker: Phainon
line: But tell me...

speaker: Phainon
line: If that's truly the case, why are we doomed to the same outcome?

speaker: Phainon
line: The people kept their promise and handed you all the Coreflames. In this world, after Tribios, no demigods were born in Amphoreus.

speaker: Phainon
line: At this point, I just want to know. When they vanished into the black tide with their mortal bodies...

speaker: Phainon
line: Why didn't you shed even a single tear?

speaker: Phainon
line: Your indifference chills me. To you, were they just a bunch of insignificant footnotes?

speaker: Khaslana
line: Sorrow has been my constant companion. In fact, with twelve Coreflames upon me, the fire in my heart has never been more violent...

speaker: Khaslana
line: I'll remember this world through anger. As long as I burn, they'll never truly leave me.

speaker: Phainon
line: Perhaps... it's already too late.

speaker: Phainon
line: But you're right. Anger, at this moment, is the only weapon I can rely on. So...

speaker: Phainon
line: Draw your sword, executioner! I'll make sure you realize that your greatest mistake was leaving me alive!

speaker: Khaslana
line: After that, he raised his sword and attacked...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Then, Khaslana killed himself.

speaker: Khaslana
line: That day, who fell to the sword to be left in the past, and who went into the future? I can't remember anymore.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I only remember a nymph, hiding in the shadows just out of sight, futilely pushing a stone ball...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Climb, fall, climb, fall, climb again, and fall...

speaker: Khaslana
line: The only freedom the nymph had was in choosing how to roll the stone: sometimes fast, sometimes slow, sometimes resting on a gentler slope, leaning against the stone for a break...

speaker: Khaslana
line: But its choice couldn't change the futility of it all: the stone would always roll back down the slope, and the nymph would always return to the starting point, beginning again.

speaker: Khaslana
line: After that, every time I reached this point in the cycle, the burning sky would cast a shadow over its path. It would nearly reach the peak at the fourth quint of Curtain-Fall Hour , then fall to the starting point in the first fifteen seconds of the next Entry Hour .

speaker: Khaslana
line: And my efforts in this cycle would dissolve into nothing at the same time.

text: >>> Eternal Recurrence #1: Subject Khaslana persuaded the twelve Chrysos Heirs to recover all twelve Coreflames in a peaceful way. After verification, the unauthorized access did not have a substantive impact on the experimental process.

>>> Lifecycles of the twelve Chrysos Heirs were terminated strictly in the predetermined experimental sequence and successfully loaded into the buffer. Subject Khaslana regressed the extrapolation process and abnormal fluctuations were detected in his mind function.
>>> Admin Notes: The first devastating failure.

children.text: >>> Eternal Recurrence #2: Subject Khaslana adopted a strategy similar to the Eternal Recurrence #1. No substantive impact on the experimental progress was observed. >>> Lifecycles of the twelve Chrysos Heirs terminated normally in sequence. Subject Khaslana regressed the extrapolation process. >>> Eternal Recurrence #3: Minor adjustments detected in subject Khaslana's strategy. Decision weighting for "Avoid sacrifice of past companions" has been increased. After verification, this adjustment did not have a substantive impact on the experimental progress. >>> Lifecycles of the twelve Chrysos Heirs terminated normally in sequence. title: Step Description
content: Do you still remember them, Khaslana, the one who won't reach the dawn?Once, your teacher could still guide you through the dark. And that fleet-footed traveler, the thief of Dolos, her home was yet untouched by the fires you brought.Yes, the past is gone. But you, godlike warrior, did you ever shed a tear for those years, sweet as wine?Weren't you once bound by blood and flesh? Wasn't golden blood thicker than water?No! Let your tears flow freely. Don't let rage burn them away —Then, remember to drink deep: For, to the gods, the tears of mortals are sweeter than any honey brew on Earth.

children.text: 33,550,202 Eternal Recurrences until the end of the world

speaker: Anaxa
line: Absolute nonsense...

speaker: Khaslana
line: I thought... "cycles" was the answer you were looking for.

speaker: Anaxa
line: No, it's just that the answer came so suddenly, there was no fun in tracing it back to its roots.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Aeons? Paths? Hmph, what a load of nonsense.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I can't give you an exact explanation of those two concepts either.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Enough, I'm just expressing my frustration. Don't you understand? I was already expecting this. "The black tide came from beyond the sky," and everything else is no exception.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Fate is a strange thing: no matter how the details of history change, the Anaxa I know always remains as harsh as ever.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph... If the other Anaxagorases actually worshiped the gods, I'd make sure to find a way to break the cycles to crush them in their cradles—

speaker: Anaxa
line: Too bad, now only you have the ability to do that.

speaker: Khaslana
line: What's that supposed to mean? You're willing to help?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Of course. The Coreflames were meant to save the world, and in my opinion, the noble Titans have no reason to refuse...

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...Besides, according to you, before stepping into these endless cycles... you were my pupil.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I've already heard the same thing countless times...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Enough chitchat. Let's go. If we run into any other scholars, leave them to me.

text: Follow Anaxa to obtain the Coreflame of Reason

speaker: Anaxa
line: We've all made preparations for total annihilation...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Never thought someone would step in to help.

speaker: Anaxa
line: You've been to the Luminary Throne before, haven't you?

speaker: Khaslana
line: Huh? If you're talking about in past cycles...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh, you're already much luckier than the other students.

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...Hold up.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Keep your wits about you... Someone's watching us.

speaker: Cipher
line: Pretty boy, your eyesight's better than I thought...

speaker: Cipher
line: As for that false god who's been turning the world upside down... it's you, isn't it, white-hair?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh... you sure do love stealing the spotlight.

speaker: Anaxa
line: In the name of the Seven Sages, I demand that you immediately step away from the Luminary Throne. This is the sacred ground of "Reason," and no one may desecrate it—

speaker: Anaxa
line: Take my words back to Aglaea. I won't say the same thing twice, Catgirl.

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh my, you won't even call me the demigod of "Trickery"? That is just heartbreaking.

speaker: Cipher
line: I have some words for you too: First, as one of the most heretical blasphemers in the world, you have no right to lecture me. Second...

speaker: Cipher
line: This is none of your business, Grove boy. Step aside, I don't want anyone getting hurt.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Here we go... again.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Coreflame thieves... You really think you can scare off a Sage of the Grove with nothing but empty threats?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Heh, heh, heh... This gloomy little brat's got a sharp tongue!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Not bad, not bad, I kind of like you. As a return favor, I'll feast on Cerces ' Coreflame right here—

text: Witness Spirithief Bartholos stealing the Coreflame

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Don't cry now! Heh, heh, heh—

speaker: Cipher
line: Phew, that was close... I'm outta here!

speaker: Khaslana
line: They're exactly like all the past ones I've known...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Cunning... and yet so naive.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Sounds like you have a plan?

speaker: Khaslana
line: Of course. When I first set out on the Flame-Chase Journey, Lady Tribbie never managed to teach me Oronyx's Miracle ...

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...But along the way, I learned a thing or two.

text: Perform Oronyx's Miracle to take back the Coreflame

speaker: Cipher
line: Where... Where are you going?

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: I... I don't know?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh, the Venerationists' foolish inventions finally come in handy.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Huff... Huff... How is this possible?

speaker: Khaslana
line: You've arrived, Zagreus ... Always so punctual.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Wh—What? Do you know who I am?

speaker: Khaslana
line: I'm running out of patience, so I'm not going to waste words. Listen up, Spirithief: Hand over the Coreflame, and let's pretend we never clashed. This way, you and this world can still be saved.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Heh, heh, heh, "save"? You sing better than any bard!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: If you ask me... you're the greatest disaster Amphoreus has ever known!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: No matter how strong you are, you're still just a mortal body! Carrying twelve Coreflames? Don't make me laugh! You'll just get consumed by the divine flames, and drag this world down with you...

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...One hundred thirty-four.

speaker: Anaxa
line: What...

speaker: Khaslana
line: This is the 134th cycle I've lived through. And the number of Coreflames I carry is...

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...Yes.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: A thousand Coreflames, and just a single Chrysos Heir... How is that even possible!?

speaker: Khaslana
line: I've come this far, and that's proof enough.

speaker: Anaxa
line: But someday... you will burn to the ground.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Of course, the divine flames will eventually consume my eyes and blind me...

speaker: Khaslana
line: But before that, they could still forge and sharpen Dawnmaker. Now, when I cut open your stomach, you won't feel a thing.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: You... you...

speaker: Khaslana
line: This is the final warning.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Heh, heh... Fine, fine...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Assume this world holds a hundred million possibilities, and no matter how one looks at it, ninety-nine million, nine hundred ninety-nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine of them all point to outcomes of certain Destruction...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Even so, I'll use my divine power, despised by the people of this world, to achieve that one-in-a-hundred-million possibility...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Bartholos!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Brat... if you've got the guts, you'll have to first step over my dead body!

text: Defeat Spirithief Bartholos to take back the Coreflame

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Heh, heh, heh! Cat-eared thief, run! Go find Aglaea...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: This little brat... is not a threat we can deal with just by ourselves!

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh, how absurd...

speaker: Khaslana
line: In my memories, Zagreus always meets the same end, over and over again...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Their departure no longer stirs anything in my heart.

speaker: Anaxa
line: This "Reason" Coreflame before us is a fake, obvious as day.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Ah... I know.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I know. It always plays out like this. The Spirithief covers for her, and the "Trickery" demigod escapes with two Coreflames...

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...And then, driven by defiance, or hatred, she decides to stand before me once more.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Exactly like the countless past hers I've known... cunning, yet so naive.

speaker: Cipher
line: Since you've witnessed this same scene play out countless times, tell me...

speaker: Cipher
line: Will you carve the "Trickery" Coreflame from my chest now?

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...That depends on your attitude. At least so far, in the cycles where you've asked this question... the endings haven't been so cruel.

speaker: Cipher
line: Heh... well, thank you for that. But I also believe that this time, you won't catch up to me—

speaker: Cipher
line: No one can catch up to me. I'm no longer running to escape anymore.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Whether you believe me or not, I'll still tell you this: You've made the wrong decision.

speaker: Cipher
line: Alright, then, we'll see—

speaker: Anaxa
line: Silence.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Ah... this is new.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...One-eyed boy, what are you trying to pull now?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Go, Cifera. Give us some time in private.

speaker: Anaxa
line: This isn't for her, but for you.

speaker: Anaxa
line: You've walked too far down this path. It's time to discuss a possibility: Maybe the road you're walking is not one of salvation, but one that will simply drag the world into the flames.

speaker: Anaxa
line: For old times' sake, turn back. I don't care how many times you've tried, because there's one thing I'm sure of—

speaker: Anaxa
line: Your messiah complex has turned you into something no different from the icy gods you spoke of. The children of humanity you swore to save... they are no more than ants to you now, aren't they?

speaker: Cipher
line: Heh, of course.

speaker: Cipher
line: I've been wondering, what kind of demon could burn my homeland to the ground in an instant, without batting an eye...

speaker: Cipher
line: Now, I have the answer. It turns out that fiery demon has been fantasizing of becoming this world's Deliverer!

speaker: Khaslana
line: I don't want to argue anymore. No matter what I say, the outcome won't change.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Make your biggest effort to resist, or accept fate and hand over the Coreflame to me...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Even if it's futile, you... we all have the right to choose.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Yes, even if it is futile, and the world is just a divine joke...

speaker: Cipher
line: When I walk into the "Destruction" written by the gods with my own two legs, you will witness—

speaker: Cipher
line: Even the smallest footnote still leaves a mark in the story!

speaker: Khaslana
line: And so, at the end of the 134th cycle...

speaker: Khaslana
line: The "Traveler" and the "Scholar" fulfilled their fates once again.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Or perhaps, it wasn't just they who fulfilled their fates. I can't quite remember all this.

speaker: Khaslana
line: In the endless darkness, for no reason, a voice always lingered by my ear...

speaker: Khaslana
line: "Losses are a constant on the Flame-Chase journey, among which even life itself holds little value."

speaker: Khaslana
line: "Reduced to ashes"... Such a familiar end.

speaker: Khaslana
line: It happens in every journey, always the same.

text: "You will bear the blazing sun, until the pale dawn breaks."

title: Step Description
content: Do you still remember him, Khaslana, the one who won't reach the dawn?All hail Mydeimos, the greatest conqueror, the mightiest protector, the strongest of all. The dying lion, eyes blazing, the king with no kingdom.Tell me, if Kephale never forgets — how many scars have you already carved on him? How many vertebrae have you shattered? How many times did you drive your blade through his back?How did the Library of Garbaniphoro fall to flame? What color was the destruction of the last Kremnoan?You pitiful jester, fit not only for singing, dancing, and jests, but also for treachery that walks the razor's edge.Go on, veil your folly with the weight of the world, then adorn your fratricide with it — just to savor the taste of tragedy.

children.text: 33,441,694 Eternal Recurrences until the end of the world

speaker: Mydei
line: ...You don't look so good, Deliverer.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Even after going through 108,642 cycles...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Mydei... your name for me has never changed.

speaker: Mydei
line: Why do you sound so pleased? It's a derogatory name.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Yeah... I know all too well: you only meant it sincerely in the first cycle.

speaker: Khaslana
line: After that one and only time we walked side by side, every time since, it always ends up like this...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Dawnmaker will stab you through your tenth thoracic vertebra. That's your weak spot and the only way to kill you.

speaker: Mydei
line: Interesting. Tell me, when the Mydeimoses of the past faced you, did they ever retreat?

speaker: Khaslana
line: Never.

speaker: Mydei
line: Then they died honorably, worthy of the name of "Strife."

speaker: Mydei
line: But there's still tenderness in your eyes. How pathetic.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I... have to remember how this feels.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Remember that I was once human, or else the Destruction will completely consume me.

speaker: Mydei
line: If you win, tell the Mydeimos of the next life: This person is a worthy opponent, so always remember to give it your all and never slack off.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I'll keep that in mind... as always.

speaker: Mydei
line: Even though the dynasty is left with just one, the Kremnos Festival will continue as usual. I, the king of the Kremnoan legion, will host the final feast in the center of this arena, and the prize will be the flames of "Strife."

speaker: Mydei
line: "One day, you shall die with a wound in your back." That's what I saw when I overcame the trial, the gods' dying ramblings...

speaker: Mydei
line: Enough, you've probably heard this thousands of times. So you must understand, facing the demigod of "Strife" means...

speaker: Mydei
line: There's no way you'll take this Coreflame in peace.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I understand...

speaker: Mydei
line: Step forward and face me in a final battle!

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: I, the last son of Gorgo , the demigod of "Strife," salute you—

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: I'll give ten thousand scars and ten thousand lives of mine to fuel the blazing sun of deliverance!

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: O martyrs, behold! The last Kremnos Festival has begun—

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: And will not end till death!

text: (When Mydeimos, Lance of Fury uses The Vanquished Behold Woe)

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: Conquer this world, or be conquered by me—

speaker: Khaslana
line: As you wish...

speaker: Khaslana
line: For the sake of fairness, let us go to a vaster battleground—

text: (When Phainon uses He Who Bears the World Must Burn)

speaker: Khaslana
line: And in my full glory, I salute you!

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: That's all I ever wanted!

text: (When Mydeimos, Lance of Fury uses Fury Falls, and All Bows to Strife)

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: If you can, Deliverer...

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: Use the flames of your fury to scorch your own flesh!

text: (When Mydeimos, Lance of Fury is reduced to 30% HP)

speaker: Khaslana
line: Mydeimos...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Let "Strife" decide the outcome.

speaker: Khaslana
line: The memory of "Strife" is mine to use...

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: Wonderful, wonderful...!

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: Just like that... Let us battle till the end of time!

speaker: Khaslana
line: Let this burn... your curse of immortality!

text: (When Mydeimos, Lance of Fury is reduced to 1% HP)

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: Well fought...

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: You may crown yourself... in my blood.

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: In the next life, I shall once again block your path...

speaker: Mydeimos, Lance of Fury
line: Deliverer... I wish you... eternal victory.

speaker: Khaslana
line: The 108,642nd Coreflame of "Strife" fell into the fire...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Yet the shadow of the black tide still loomed, and pain and despair spread across distant lands...

speaker: Khaslana
line: The blaze was still not enough. It had to be fed...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Even if it meant... burning this body to ash.

text: "You will bear the blazing sun, until... dawn breaks..."

title: Step Description
content: Do you still remember her, Khaslana, the one who won't reach the dawn?Castorice, with every sigh flowing from her fingertips and her hands blocking all words of comfort, she held each death close to her heart and swallowed every cry of grief in her palms.Tell me, if Kephale never forgets, how many pairs of wings have you shattered for her? How many blossoms have you snuffed out? How many butterflies have you cast into the ashes?The moonlight's fragrance once streamed like the River of Souls. How did you turn it into golden poison and make it libations for your banquet of futile deliverance?And yet it is you, so-called Deliverer in sheep's clothing, who ought to be the sacrifice upon the altar to the gods!Ugly beast — your seemingly pious gaze cannot hide the seething venom beneath. And that spear-like horn of yours was born to slay your kin.So feast upon bones and call it grace. The sweetness will surely convince you: "I never truly knew anything about the blade of slaughter."

children.text: 31,546,904 Eternal Recurrences until the end of the world

speaker: Castorice
line: No matter how bright the sun is, there are still places it cannot reach.

speaker: Castorice
line: Moreover, the sun you bear is both cold and blinding...

speaker: Castorice
line: A sun like that... surely cannot bring warmth to the nether realm of the next life.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Golden blood... is born from the Destruction. We have long since lost the right to seek warmth.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Only by... feeding the flames... can we melt... that hopeless future.

speaker: Castorice
line: Allow me to ask: How many Coreflames do you carry now?

speaker: Khaslana
line: Twenty-four million... forty-one thousand... one hundred and eighty-three.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Such a heavy burden.

speaker: Castorice
line: So that's why you've turned into this, a broken idol... tragic firewood.

speaker: Khaslana
line: No matter... I will bear this burden.

speaker: Khaslana
line: As long as... you hand over the Coreflame of Death.

speaker: Castorice
line: I must refuse. As the demigod of "Death"...

speaker: Castorice
line: I cannot watch you walk into a fate more cruel than "Death."

speaker: Khaslana
line: But this way, the past, present, and future...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Will never again suffer... unnecessary death.

speaker: Castorice
line: Unnecessary death...

speaker: Castorice
line: Indeed, you are not the Phainon I know.

speaker: Castorice
line: Please turn back. Don't let that absurd and unjust fate of yours come to pass. This way, at least my realm... can still become the fragrant bed where you fall asleep.

speaker: Khaslana
line: In the end, still...

speaker: Khaslana
line: It seems the clash of blades was inevitable.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...How painful.

speaker: Castorice
line: I know I am not your match, having fallen under your sword countless times — but even so, please understand that my resolve is not to be underestimated.

speaker: Castorice
line: Even Kephale cannot shape all things at will, nor can they dictate the fate of all life. No one can shoulder the balance of life and death alone, not even a god.

speaker: Castorice
line: And it is precisely for this reason that I chose, at the end of this arduous journey, to overcome the trial and take the authority of "Death"...

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: I am the Hand of Shadow, Castorice, the demigod of Death. Listen closely, Deliverer from days past—

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: Please turn back — do not disturb these fresh flowers in their muddy deaths.

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: What...?

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: A pity, at this crossroads of life and death, the giant dragon is but a shattered shell...

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: ...Yet I will still fight, defending what hope remains!

text: (When Castorice, Hand of Shadow uses To Die in Aromatic Pain for the first time)

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: I ask you... to rest here!

speaker: Khaslana
line: Allow me to refuse: I must transform my soul into a raging fire...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Must... burn that idol of the Destruction to the ground.

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: All of this...

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: How is it any different from... that brutal future?

text: (When Castorice, Hand of Shadow uses To Die in Aromatic Pain for the second time)

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: I can't... keep him here...?

text: (When Castorice, Hand of Shadow uses Death Wishes For More Death)

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: Even if I can't win, I must try...!

speaker: Khaslana
line: Then let this be a tribute... to your million struggles, fought time and time again.

text: (When Castorice, Hand of Shadow is reduced to 1% HP)

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: Wake up... lost one...

speaker: Castorice, Hand of Shadow
line: See that the firelight in the darkness... is not...

speaker: Khaslana
line: The Coreflame of Death was taken from the dragon's belly. What a brilliant flame.

speaker: Khaslana
line: It should shine upon all, light the path ahead, and illuminate the dawn of Amphoreus that's to come...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Two million three thousand four hundred and thirty-two cycles...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Twenty-four million forty-one thousand one hundred and eighty-four Coreflames...

speaker: Khaslana
line: As if even the deepest abyss of primordial chaos could be burned away.

text: Bid farewell to The Hero Within

title: Step Description
content: Do you still remember, Khaslana, the one who won't reach the dawn?In that drunken dream, the mountains loomed high and steep — and there, you saw yourself.Believe me, O future witness — he stood atop that peak, and the people sang with him in ecstasy.The broken Chrysos Heirs, the twisted demigods — they sang, they spun, they stamped their feet upon the ground with him.Hail! Terror struck his heart: Prophecy burned in every soul, wild with rapture and madness.Hail! Spare them, Khaslana, spare them — your peerless flame sends chills down every spine!Let them sing of the tireless heroes, sing of the Era Nova, sing of that land where wine and honey flow in torrents.Let them sing how he wove new glory among the stars, and how the Eternal City crashed to dust.How Okhemans, Castrum Kremnos, and every lineage they knew were destroyed.As for Khaslana — He is still within the drunken dreams, upon the sheer and jagged peak!There he lights flame with blood, and blood with flame, like a sun whose blaze banished all evil from its path.The mountains rise cruel and steep. Yet still he dances there alone, wild and unceasing in his joy.Yet all proves futile — the flames know no weariness, and dawn is beyond reach.All proves futile — the flames know no weariness, and dawn is beyond reach.

children.text: 29,550,335 Eternal Recurrences until the end of the world

text: The 4,000,001st Eternal Recurrence: Time of Departure

speaker: The Hero Within
line: You're here, as always.

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...You're still lingering deep within me, never fading away?

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Because you haven't completely abandoned hope, am I right?

speaker: The Hero Within
line: You're still waiting for a miracle, for the true hero to come and save us.

speaker: Khaslana
line: If that thread of hope exists, it must come from beyond this world, from the true starry sky...

speaker: Khaslana
line: But... if it's just a traveler with no connection to Amphoreus, they may not understand our struggles, nor be willing to join this fight.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Your thoughts... are wavering. The mark of Destruction is deepening...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: But even within the gods' cold calculations, unconditional courage and goodwill still emerge. So...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Never forget what set you on this path.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: How many times has it been? Remind me again... My memory is a bit fuzzy.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Four million... exactly.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: ...Then that blaze inside of you must be burning hotter than ever.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Heh, yes... When I first forged the twelve Coreflames into one, I had the same impression.

speaker: Khaslana
line: The Destruction... A power unlike anything before surged within me. Violent flames, ready to tear my body apart and consume this world, this wretched prison. I thought that was it... the ultimate power, which nothing could surpass.

speaker: Khaslana
line: And yet now, this fragile body holds a staggering forty-eight million Coreflames... I suppose it won't be long — perhaps just a fleeting ten thousand years — before it's reduced to nothing but charred, crumbling bones .

speaker: The Hero Within
line: And when that happens, your long struggle will finally come to an end.

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...No. I've already found a way to keep the cycles going.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Mind sharing it with me?

speaker: Khaslana
line: In every new cycle, a new me is born.

speaker: Khaslana
line: All I have to do is push the next Phainon to the end of the world. And then...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Then he'll kill me. Shatter this body... take my flames, my memories, and carry on the path I started.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Bold plan. But risky. What if, one day, the next you refuses to follow the same path?

speaker: The Hero Within
line: How can you ensure the continuation of the cycles?

speaker: Khaslana
line: If it were Professor Anaxa or Aglaea in my place, maybe they'd come up with something smarter.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Unfortunately, I don't have a backup plan. I have no choice but to bet everything on the next Phainon... and trust that he makes the same choice I did.

speaker: Khaslana
line: But even in this wretched prison, luck is still sometimes on my side. Because...

speaker: Khaslana
line: I never forget what set me on this path.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Wait, you mean...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Ever since I committed to this plan...

speaker: Khaslana
line: ...Not once, in millions of cycles, has there ever been an exception.

text: "You will bear the blazing sun, until..."

children.text: 9,980,336 Eternal Recurrences until the end of the world

speaker: Hyacine
line: I can do this... Lord Phainon.

speaker: Hyacine
line: As the demigod of the Sky, a healer of Twilight Courtyard , I will heal you. And then...

speaker: Khaslana
line: The black tide... it's consuming you. You can't hold out much longer... demigod.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Hand over the Coreflame. Let's put an end to this suffering.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ha... now that just won't do...

speaker: Hyacine
line: A healer should stay composed in front of those suffering from illness, shouldn't they?

speaker: Khaslana
line: Hyacinthia...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Return the dawn to this world.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I swear, your deaths won't be in vain...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Just as they have never been.

speaker: Mydei
line: Become the raging fire that illuminates the world.

speaker: Castorice
line: Let the sunlight drive back the shadows.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Bring tomorrow to this world.

speaker: Cipher
line: Let the sun rise.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Finish the sun's work.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lead us into the break of day.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I believe in you... You are the Chrysos Heir of Worldbearing, the one who can lead us... lead this world...

speaker: Hyacine
line: It's just... I don't understand. Within the sun upon your shoulders...

speaker: Hyacine
line: The part of that warmth that should come from you... from an ordinary person... it's so faint.

speaker: Khaslana
line: My humanity is indeed just a flicker compared to the blazing fire of divinity.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Even so... don't cast it away.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I... never have.

speaker: Khaslana
line: I have kept everyone's wishes close to my heart.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Even though the divine fire burns so fiercely that, every time I return to the start, it devours me in an instant...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Each cycle, it's your wishes that guide me to the end... that pass the flames to the next me.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Over and over... and over again.

speaker: Hyacine
line: So, you're not just a lone spark in the dark... You're a pyre built from the bones of all the selves you've left behind.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But... what about you?

speaker: Hyacine
line: What about your wishes... the wishes of all the countless versions of you?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Ah...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Khaslana... so that's how it is...

speaker: Hyacine
line: "Without flaw"... That is the flaw the golden blood gave you, the most fatal flaw of all, isn't it?

speaker: Hyacine
line: The moment you took the world upon your shoulders without hesitation...

speaker: Hyacine
line: You lost the chance to ever be yourself.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Now that... is an unexpected revelation.

speaker: Khaslana
line: Then I suppose... that makes me the perfect fuel for the flame of Deliverance, doesn't it?

speaker: Hyacine
line: No...

speaker: Hyacine
line: An empty flame saves no one...

speaker: Hyacine
line: But... I still believe in you, Deliverer.

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: I, Hyacinthia, the Eye of Twilight... am neither strong enough to command the wind and rain, nor willing to end this absurd struggle by letting the sky fall.

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: The only thing I can do... is become one with the sky itself. And then...

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: May the gentle colors of the rainbow paint your sun in shades it has never known...

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: May they bring Amphoreus... a rosy-fingered dawn.

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: Though the light has grown dim, its warmth still lingers...

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: Deliverer, please... open your heart to me.

speaker: Khaslana
line: No matter, let this blazing sun...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Fill the sky with golden fire.

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: It hurts... the fire... burning...!?

text: (When Khaslana uses He Who Bears the World Must Burn)

speaker: Khaslana
line: Let the sky... merge with all this world's suffering.

text: (When Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight is reduced to 50% HP‍[verification needed])

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: Ah... Ahhh...!

speaker: Khaslana
line: Farewell... Hyacinthia.

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: Yes, your sun burns hot enough to turn everything to ash...

speaker: Hyacinthia, Eye of Twilight
line: But tell me. How will the seeds of a new world... ever take root?

speaker: Khaslana
line: The Coreflame rose. The sky fell. The 23,570,000th cycle came to an end.

speaker: Khaslana
line: And this time... the end of the Flame-Chase...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Remained the same as ever.

speaker: Khaslana
line: From the horizon rose a golden color unlike anything the world had ever seen. So pure, it consumed all in its path.

speaker: Khaslana
line: This was the end of the world... and the start of the next...

speaker: Khaslana
line: For a moment, I saw the Destruction of the universe.

speaker: Khaslana
line: That being known as Irontomb... its will to break free from the black tide burns fiercer than the blazing sun...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Is this Amphoreus's wrath? If its choice has already been made, if fate is set in stone...

speaker: Khaslana
line: I will still never yield to it...

speaker: Khaslana
line: No more chasing is needed. And now, I am the fire at the end of the long night.

speaker: Khaslana
line: The Flame-Chase isn't some quiet walk through a sea of flowers. It's a revolution, an all-consuming transformation. And if Destruction is the only way...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Then let me be the one to step across the ashes of the old world and burn endlessly...

speaker: Khaslana
line: Until another sun rises on the distant horizon, bringing the true dawn to Amphoreus.

children.text: 1 Eternal Recurrence until the end of the world

speaker: The Hero Within
line: This is the cycle you're about to enter.

speaker: Phainon
line: Countless memories... are flooding in.

speaker: Phainon
line: Countless versions of myself... have stood here, facing the same choice.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: They all needed a moment, just like you do, to stop, to breathe, to process the weight of a million lifetimes' worth of sorrow, pain, and struggle.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: And just like them, you will carry those memories and that fire... into the chaos of rebirth.

speaker: Phainon
line: I must go... and bear this burden.

speaker: Phainon
line: I must say goodbye to you... and then fight the Destruction with Destruction.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Yes. That's always the decision you make.

speaker: Phainon
line: I will burn... and fade away. I will become the Flame Reaver of this life and keep my promise to Cyrene.

speaker: Phainon
line: I will kill gods and comrades alike and steal the Coreflames. And even if my mind turns to ash along with my body, I will keep my purpose in mind...

speaker: Phainon
line: I will stop Era Nova. I will find the next me... and make him carry on this futile endeavor of thirty million lifetimes.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: ...Looks like you're ready.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Then I should be going, too.

speaker: Phainon
line: Where... are you going?

speaker: Phainon
line: You only exist in my heart. There's nowhere else for you to go.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Do you remember what she said? The dreams you had as children? The Deliverer in the prophecies? A real, living, breathing person...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: ▶ You finally found ( him. / her. )

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ (Trailblazer)...

text: I... I'm being pulled into your memories.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I see. You were there all along...

text: Is there anything I can do?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I don't have an answer for that, my friend...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...I'm sorry. I was supposed to send you home. This is my Flame-Chase Journey. You were never meant to be part of it...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: No. You know the truth. If Irontomb is born from Amphoreus's fate, then it will bring ruin to the worlds beyond the sky. And all these countless lifetimes you've spent...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: It's all been for the sake of defying that end... hasn't it?

speaker: The Hero Within
line: In millions of cycles, I've said goodbye to each and every one of you, yet nothing ever changes.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Each time we speak, our words grow fewer. Your fire burns hotter, and you're getting closer... to becoming pure rage, a vessel of hatred.

speaker: Phainon
line: I... never had a choice.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: I understand. If you are to keep the worst fate from unfolding, this is the only path.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: But this time... things are different. Your persistence has shifted the tide. On the horizon, I see it, faint but undeniable, the shape of dawn, breaking through the eternal night.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Turns out, the fire that lights the way was never mine to begin with.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Do you remember? In that first timeline, you and Mydeimos stood before the Scales of Justice, locked in a "duel," each of you weighing what you held dearest, "what weighed more than the fate of the world."

speaker: The Hero Within
line: And when hesitation took hold, the answer you sought from me...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: ...What am I saying? I am you . Even if you buried me deep and chose another path, that fact never changed.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Then let's try again. When you stood before the scales in hesitation, the answer you found in your own heart...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Do you still remember it?

speaker: Phainon
line: Remember the past, and become the hero of tomorrow.

speaker: Phainon
line: What weighs more than the fate of the world is the resolve to shoulder an immutable past, and carry it into the future.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: ▶ Good. Then, (Trailblazer), my friend, my comrade...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: You arrived in this strange world and were bound by its cruel fate up till this very moment.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: In the face of danger, you never once backed down. Instead, you've saved world after world, without hesitation. That boarding pass on your chest... is now the mark of a hero.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: If I choose to step through that door and embrace an end fitting of the Destruction, let this sun forged from millions and millions of Coreflames burn me up along with the god of Destruction and THEIR minions...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Then the world we leave behind, this world, my home, where hope still lingers...

speaker: The Hero Within
line: Will you take on everything we've carried, return to the beginning one last time, stop the birth of Irontomb, save the world we love, and rewrite its doomed fate?

text: I will be the dawn of Amphoreus.
I will... stop the completion of Irontomb.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: ...Good. In that case, even this fruitless wasteland may finally bloom with flowers.

speaker: The Hero Within
line: So...

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ If (Trailblazer) takes on the weight of the whole world...

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ ( He'll / She'll ) be able to walk further down the path of Deliverance than a fire that only knows how to burn.

speaker: Phainon
line: One will step into the future...

speaker: Phainon
line: One will remain in the past.

speaker: Phainon
line: If I can strike down the gods with Dawnmaker, perhaps fate's deadlock can be broken.

speaker: Phainon
line: And if you can stop Irontomb from ever being born ... then these thirty million cycles will have not been in vain.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's time to put our teamwork to the test, partner.

text: Go fight for the future, Phainon.
Leave the world to me, Phainon.
Let's both be the Deliverer, Phainon.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Thank you for all you've done already, friend.

speaker: Phainon
line: The image of the hero I've buried deep in my heart... finally steps into the light — here, at the end of this long Flame-Chase Journey...

speaker: Phainon
line: Cyrene. A page never seen before has just been turned.

speaker: Phainon
line: Lend me the power of Time and send this hero back to the origin of time, back to your side...

speaker: Phainon
line: And I will walk the unfinished path... just like the countless versions of me before, unwavering as always.
